game.name: Atari Go
game.history: Atari Go was first introduced by Yasuda Tasutoshi, an 8 Dan professional Go player. It is a 2 player, simplified version of Go, invented especially for beginning players to learn about the tactical fundamentals of Go.
game.board: The game of Go is played on a grid board. The size of the board may vary depending on the players' preference. Some can be 19x19, 13x13, 9x9, etc.
game.pieces: There are two colored stones, black and white.
game.tomove: A move consists of the player putting one of their pieces on an empty intersection of the board.
game.towin: The first player to capture one or more pieces (depending on how many pieces you and your opponent want) wins.
game.rules: The rules for Atari Go are similar to those of regular Go. The player with the black stones moves first. Both players alternatively move, however, once a stone is placed on the board, the player is not allowed to move it. The only way that stones can be moved is being captured. Capturing is when one f your or your opponent's piece is surrounded.
